lesson.title: Animation and Narration
lesson.summary: Students will learn how to add audio and narration to their data stories using Flourish, including setting up the files, charts, animation and audio files to create interactive stories.

atoms.title: lesson intro outline
atoms.text:
## Welcome to Lesson 4

In this lesson we will use the Bubble chart we made in Flourish to create a story, similar to the Story Points feature we used in Tableau. There will be two key differences to the Flourish story, though. First, our audience will be able to see an animated version of the Bubble chart in the browser. Second, we will be able to upload an audio file with narration for our audience to listen to the story we create for them.

Here are the steps we’ll go through in this final lesson:
* reate a new Story in Flourish
* Add new slides & narrative text
* Specify duration for each slide
* Record an audio file to MP3
* Add audio to the story
* Play & share the story with others

atoms.title: Instruction for Exercise 1
atoms.text:
## Exercise #1: Creating a New Flourish Story
In this exercise, we’ll see how to create a new story in Flourish and add a title slide

#### Instructions:
1. From your “My projects” page in Flourish, click on “+new” in the Stories section
2. Click on “Basic slide” & give it a Title, Subtitle & Text
3. Edit the image & upload a photograph related to cell phones and/or sanitation (check Pexels.com).
Feel free to use [this one](https://images.pexels.com/photos/1826060/pexels-photo-1826060.jpeg?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&dpr=2&h=750&w=1260)
4. Add a caption at the top to introduce the topic
5. Give the story a title in Flourish

concepts.title: Adding New Slides and Narrative Text

atoms.title: what steps to take
atoms.text:
### Let's revisit the steps outlined in the video:
1. Add new slides to your Story
2. Add a new blank slide
3. Add a visualization to it
4. Duplicate and customize
5. Add narrative text

atoms.title: instructions for Exercise 2
atoms.text:
## Exercise #2: Adding New Slides to your Story

#### Instructions:
1. Add a bubble chart visualization to a new slide. 
2. You can select the bubble chart (mobile phone subscriptions & sanitation chart you made in Lesson 3)
3. Re-create this at least 3 times, and in each slide choose a filter setting to tell a different aspect of the story.
4. Add labels and narrative text to go along with your story.
5. Enable Autoplay in the top left corner
6. With a simple cell phone timer or stopwatch, time yourself reading the narrative text at the top of each slide.
7.  Match the “Duration” field in each slide with the number of seconds you need to take to comfortably narrate the story.

concepts.title: Recording an Audio File to MP3

atoms.text: In the following video, you will see how to add the audio recording to your Flourish story and to publish it.

atoms.title: Recording Audio on Windows & Mac
atoms.text:
There are many ways to record an audio file using free software. You can use your iPhone or Android device, or you can use a handheld voice recorder such as the Zoom h2n. Alternately, you can use a computer running either Windows 10 or Mac OS X to record your voice as outlined below:

#### For Windows 10:
* Use the built-in Voice Recorder to create an .M4A file:
* Start > type in “Voice Recorder”
* Click on the Voice Recorded app
* Click on the microphone icon to begin recording
* Click the Stop button to stop the recording

#### For Mac OS X:
* Use the QuickTime Player to record an .M4A file:
* Finder > Applications > QuickTime Player
* File > New Audio Recording
* Click the play button to start recording
* Click the stop button to stop

atoms.title: Converting from .M4A to .MP3
atoms.text:
### File Formats:
At present, Flourish only takes .MP3 files as audio file uploads. If the audio file you recorded is in a different format, you will need to convert it to .MP3 before uploading. There are a number of ways to do that. Here are a few that you can try:

### Options to convert audio file format:
* Convert to MP3 format using media editing software applications like Audacity, Garage Band, or VLC (among others)
* Find an online file format conversion site:
 * Zamzar (www.zamzar.com)
 * CloudConvert (https://cloudconvert.com/m4a-to-mp3)
 * Poodll Record MP3 online (https://recordmp3online.com/)

There are several others that you may find online, if any of these listed above don't work.

atoms.title: Instructions for Exercise 4
atoms.text:
## Record your audio file

The objective of this next step is to play our Flourish story in the browser while recording our voice reading through the narrative text at the top of each slide. 

To complete this step, here are the instructions again:
1. Export & publish your story to the web
2.  Click on the link to go to your published story
3. Open your audio recording application, begin recording, and then click the Play button on your story 
4. When the story has played all the way through, stop the recording
5. Convert the audio file to MP3

#### Note about recording adjustments
Note that it’s common to need to make adjustments to the duration of each slide as you read through the narrative text. Sometimes a slide changes to quickly, and other times it stays for too long. After tweaking the durations, you will need to republish the story and re-record your audio. For longer stories with more than 6 or 7 slides, it’s not uncommon to need to record different sections and then join these files together using a free audio mixing software package.

atoms.title: Common types of charts in Flourish
atoms.text:
We’ve seen how to make a story out of a Bubble chart built in Flourish, but it’s worth noting that Flourish allows you to create much more than just Bubble charts. There are literally dozens of chart types you can create with Flourish. 

See their template gallery to get an idea of what’s possible, including area charts, line charts, pie charts, a wide variety of maps, Sankey charts, chord diagrams and even tables, to name just a few :

https://app.flourish.studio/templates
